experience: You and Usha both know Adwait Ullal, Bernard Ong, and 22 others

As an Infrastructure Engineering Technical Program Manager responsible for the following:♦ 	Manage cross-functional site infrastructure projects in a matrix organization covering a range of areas (data center, network, hardware systems, software engineering, production engineering, site reliability operations, and capacity engineering).♦ 	Understand Facebook software and hardware web architecture, systems, and production operations at scale.♦ 	Develop and manage end-to-end program lifecycle and ensure on-time delivery of programs.♦ 	Interface with cross-functional teams to insure scope, schedule, resources are aligned across teams.♦ 	Provide hands on program management with deep understanding of the need to deliver production systems full speed and at scale.♦ 	Gain partnership with teams during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases.♦ 	Insure risks are accounted for and provide risk mitigation strategies.♦ 	Coordinate activities across many cross-functional teams, communicating through proper channels and levels.♦ 	Drive internal process improvements, remove gaps, across multiple teams and functions and insure teams are working on programs moving toward higher level company mission and goals.

Sole responsibility for full cycle recruitment for the OneLink Project which requires hiring of ERP operations and techno functional professionals with background in Oracle, SAP, PeopleSoft, Cognos, Hyperion. Other areas of recruitment support include Revenue Cycle Audit, Human Resources, Facilities, Construction, Engineering, Sales, Technology, Finance, Accounting, Marketing  etc.
Responsible for full cycle recruitment of mid to senior level Audit/IT staff for a highly visible technology project in the role of an individual contributor for the Internal Audit department.

October 20, 2010, Usha worked with Tom in the same group

Usha was a colleague of mine at Schering-Plough during a time that was very challanging for a recruiter. She was responsible for sourcing and hiring  external talent during a period of company rebuilding following the imposition of an FDA consent decree on this global pharmaceutical giant. She displayed unequalled talent as a full cycle recruiter with expertise supporting Quality, Compliance and Procurement, and Supply Chain positions across the whole spectrum of job levels. Of particular note was her leadership role in an integration project with Bayer where she was responsible for the successful merging of Bayer and SP talent. She was responsible for leading, creating and managing the process from interview to offer. I can give my highest recommendation of Usha for her professionalism, attention to detail and dedication in achieving positive results while under pressure.

I have been working with Usha Raghavan in the National Functions Talent Acquisition team at Kaiser Permanente since 2005. Usha has a high aptitude for various systems and applications (applicant tracking systems, mainframe, MS Office) and leads our team in using social networks to generate candidate pipelines. She is very proactive in using referrals, networking, job boards, associations, and niche sites to find candidates for difficult-to-fill positions. Her clients and teammates can attest that her work ethic is exemplary. I would recommend Usha for any recruitment position inside and outside of Kaiser Permanente. She would be an amazing asset to any organization.
